examples: he accepted a pen as a present
synonyms: acquire More"she accepted a pen as a present"take on
take responsibility for "he accepted the job immediately"

definitions.definition: give an affirmative answer to (an offer or proposal); say yes to.
examples: he would accept their offer and see what happened
synonyms: take responsibility for More"he accepted the job immediately"say yes to
agree to "she accepted an invitation to lunch"go along with
respect; formalaccede to "we have agreed to accept his decision"

definitions.definition: say yes to a proposal of marriage from (a man).
examples: Ronald is a good match and she ought to accept him

definitions.definition: receive as adequate, valid, or suitable.
examples: the college accepted her as a student

definitions.definition: regard favorably or with approval; welcome.
examples: the Harvard literati never accepted him as one of them
synonyms: adopt "she was accepted as one of the family"

definitions.definition: (of a thing) be designed to allow (something) to be inserted or applied.
examples: vending machines that accepted 100-yen coins for cans of beer

definitions.definition: believe or come to recognize (an opinion, explanation, etc.) as valid or correct.
examples: this tentative explanation came to be accepted by the group
synonyms: stock "newspaper ads from the 1700s show that
the brokering of slaves was an accepted practice"

definitions.definition: take upon oneself (a responsibility or liability); acknowledge.
examples: Jenkins is willing to accept his responsibility

definitions.definition: tolerate or submit to (something unpleasant or undesired).
examples: they accepted the need to cut expenses
synonyms: make the best of; face up to "she will just have to accept the consequences"
